qas.question: What spectrum of light is red within?
Which color is opposite of red on the visible spectrum?
On the spectrum of light, where is red found?

context: <b5_0>Red<b5_0/> is the color at the end of the spectrum of <a0_0>visible light<a0_0/> next to <a3_0>orange<a3_0/> and opposite <a1_0>violet<a1_0/>. <b6_0>Red<b6_0/> color has a predominant light wavelength of roughly <a2_0>620–740 nanometres<a2_0/>. Red is one of the additive primary colors of visible light, along with green and blue, which in <b7_0>Red Green Blue<b7_0/> (RGB) color systems are combined to create all the colors on a computer monitor or television screen. Red is also one of the <a4_0>subtractive primary colors<a4_0/>, along with yellow and blue, of the RYB color space and traditional color wheel used by painters and artists.
